GetAuths: The sample will try to find the token in Discord’s log files and tries to validate it through Discord’s API (https[:]//discord.com/api/v8/users/@me).
And extract any useful information it has, including the victim’s MFA code.
ParseLog: The sample will try to find the token in Discord’s log files and tries to validate it through Discord’s API (https[:]//discord.com/api/v8/users/@me).
CheckToken: Finally, before sending the token back to the C2, it will try to validate it through Discord’s API.
GetSessionFiles: The following method will read any session Steam files to obtain the username, installed apps, cookies and password if it has been saved.
GetLoginFromCookies: The sample will also try to use any Steam related cookies it might have obtained, to send a GET request to Steam, in an attempt to validate the cookies it has gotten.
If successful, it will send back the cookie, email associated with that account, username, and balance in Steam wallet.
GetCookies: The way it does this, is simply by running SQL queries on the Chromium DB.
Like a lot of other “stealers”, this malware will try to extract the following data from Chromium DB: Cookies, Credit cards, Logins
GetCreditCards: The way it does this, is simply by running SQL queries on the Chromium DB.
Like a lot of other “stealers”, this malware will try to extract the following data from Chromium DB: Cookies, Credit cards, Logins
